title: Ryan Reynolds continues troll war with Hugh Jackman with NSFW message
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Seems Ryan Reynolds really isn’t down to put his war with Hugh Jackman to the side, as he mixed a birthday message with a spot of trolling overnight.

Hugh celebrated his 51st birthday on 12 October and right at the last minute Ryan rolled in with a very NSFW message of celebration.

Only, it was the perfect addition to their long-running faux feud.

Ryan began the video with a message to his arch nemesis by saying: I was just going to wish you happy birthday, then I saw what you said…ah, in a word, hurtful.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Yeah. Ah, enjoy the show, Hugh Jackman.’

It’s not all that clear what Hugh had done, however the two have been going back and forth with hurtful barbs for months and months, nay, years now.

Ryan’s message is beautiful (Picture: Rex Features)

He then launched himself into a stirring rendition of happy birthday, that, frankly, is worthy of being on Broadway.

Which is exactly what Ryan thought, as he ended the sweet message by turning it hilariously venomous.

‘And I’m not even f**king professionally-trained, Jackman, you piece of s**t mother**ker,’ Ryan yelled at the camera, as he flipped Hugh the bird.

Of course it made it all the way to Hugh’s eyes, as the actor and Broadway star shared the video to Twitter for the world to see.

The pair have been in a troll war…and it’s glorious (Picture: Getty Images)

He captioned it: ‘At first I thought – Ugh, now I actually have to apologize. But then … @VancityReynolds.’

Yeah, no need for an apology.

The Wolverine actor and Ryan have been at war in a terribly sarcastic and hilarious way for years over Ryan’s insistence Hugh return to his Logan ways so the two Marvel comics characters can star in a film together.

It’s a simple ask that’s gone to the extremes with a fair amount of brilliant trolling, all for our entertainment.

The two have been the ultimate fighters (like, Jake Gyllenhaal is even in on this), but back in February, they appeared to put it all behind them as they called a truce. We thought it would all be over and peace would be restored, with Ryan reaching out to The Greatest Showman with an olive branch of sorts.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Taking to Twitter, he wrote: ‘As a gesture of goodwill, I’m gonna make a beautiful ad for his company, Laughing Man Coffee. Can’t wait!’

In the aptly-titled video, ‘Truce’, the two made an ad for one another’s company – Ryan’s being Aviator Gin, and Hugh’s Laughing Man Coffee. Of course, that didn’t go to plan at all and the truce was definitely not upheld when Hugh trolled Ryan big time.

Ah, when will it end with these two?

Never, we hope.
